oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Faculty Tiering and Academic Inbreeding: One Institution's Relationships and Realities
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Blanke, Debra
Hyle, Adrienne
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "Like inbreeding, if the proliferation of faculty tiering is problematic for academe, this institution is promoting faculty tiering, but at a lower rate than national trends. But, inbreeding and faculty tiering appear to be related, with more inbred faculty in lower tiered positions."
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Education Leadership Research Center, Texas A&M University
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Advancing Women in Leadership Journal; No. 6 (2000)
